  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws ImplerException
      The main method of the Implementor program. This method takes two command-line arguments: the name of an interface to implement and a path to a directory in which to generate the implementation file.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments passed to the program. This should be an array with one string: the name of the interface to implement.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the provided arguments are invalid or if there is an error during implementation. This exception is thrown if: - args is null or has length != 1 - args[0] is null - the interface with the provided name does not exist - the path provided is invalid

    • anyNull

      private static boolean anyNull(String[] array)
      Utility method for checking is there any element is null in provided array.
      Parameters:
      array - Array we are looking for null in.
      Returns:
      Returns true if any element in array gives true on Objects.isNull(java.lang.Object), false otherwise.

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: Impler
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: JarImpler
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.
